008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.util.bits;
010
011import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
012
013/**
014 * This class implements a true 2D bitmap container, i.e., each 0/1 element
015 * occupies only a single bit (unlike {@code boolean} arrays, which require at 
016 * least 8 bits per element).
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 * @version 2021/01/30
020 */
021public class BitMap {
022        
023        /** the width of this bitmap */
024        private final int width;
025        /** the height of this bitmap */
026        private final int height;
027        
028        private final BitVector bitvec;
029        
030        /**
031         * Constructor.
032         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
033         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
034         */
035        public BitMap(int width, int height) {
036                this(width, height, null);
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Constructor.
041         * @param width width the width of the new bitmap
042         * @param height height the height of the new bitmap
043         * @param bytes a byte array, 0 maps to false, anything else to true
044         */
045        public BitMap(int width, int height, byte[] bytes) {
046                this.width = width;
047                this.height = height;
048                this.bitvec = (bytes != null) ? BitVector.from(bytes) : BitVector.create(width * height);
049        }
050        
051        public int getWidth() {
052                return this.width;
053        }
054        
055        public int getHeight() {
056                return this.height;
057        }
058        
059        /**
060         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
061         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
062         * @param x the x-coordinate
063         * @param y the y-coordinate
064         * @return as described
065         */
066        public boolean get(int x, int y) {
067                return bitvec.get(y * width + x);
068        }
069        
070        /**
071         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
072         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
073         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
074         * @return as described
075         */
076        public boolean get(PntInt p) {
077                return bitvec.get(p.y * width + p.x);
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
082         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
083         * @param x the x-coordinate
084         * @param y the y-coordinate
085         * @param val a boolean value
086         */
087        public void set(int x, int y, boolean val) {
088                if (val) {
089                        this.set(x, y);
090                }
091                else {
092                        this.unset(x, y);
093                }
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
098         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
099         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
100         * @param val a boolean value
101         */
102        public void set(PntInt p, boolean val) {
103                set(p.x, p.y, val);
104        }
105        
106        /**
107         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
108         * @param x the x-coordinate
109         * @param y the y-coordinate
110         */
111        public void set(int x, int y) {
112                bitvec.set(y * width + x);
113        }
114        
115        /**
116         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
117         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
118         */
119        public void set(PntInt p) {
120                bitvec.set(p.y * width + p.x);
121        }
122        
123        /**
124         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
125         * @param x the x-coordinate
126         * @param y the y-coordinate
127         */
128        public void unset(int x, int y) {
129                bitvec.unset(y * width + x);
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
134         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
135         */
136        public void unset(PntInt p) {
137                bitvec.unset(p.y * width + p.x);
138        }
139        
140        /**
141         * Sets all elements to 1.
142         */
143        public void setAll() {
144                bitvec.setAll();
145        }
146        
147        /**
148         * Sets all elements to 0.
149         */
150        public void unsetAll() {
151                bitvec.unsetAll();
152        }
153        
154        /**
155         * Returns the underlying 1D {@link BitVector}.
156         * @return the bit vector
157         */
158        public BitVector getBitVector() {
159                return this.bitvec;
160        }
161        
162        // static methods --------------------------------------------------
163        
164        /**
165         * Creates a new 2D bitmap of the specified size.
166         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
167         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
168         * @return the new bitmap
169         */
170        public static BitMap create(int width, int height) {
171                return new BitMap(width, height);
172        }
173        
174}
